rationale: The current CSS removes focus outlines on email inputs with 'outline: none' and provides no focus styling for links or buttons. This makes keyboard navigation impossible for users who cannot use a mouse, including those with motor impairments.
problemSolved: Only one focus style exists (email input) which removes the default outline. Links and the navigation have no visible focus states. The CSS line 303-304 shows: .email-form input[type="email"]:focus { outline: none; }
